brewery.brewery_description: WEST is the only brewery in the UK to produce all its lagers and wheat beers in accordance with the Reinheitsgebot, the German Purity Law. WEST is a proud Glasgow brewery, which was formed in 2006 to produce outstanding beers in the German brewing tradition for the Scottish market. Despite being a relatively “small player” in the UK beer market, WEST has gained a unique reputation as the brewer of choice for upmarket/Premium outlets UK wide.  Our customer base and sales have grown to such an extent that we are building a second brewery, which will be fully operational by late 2013. WEST on Glasgow Green is also home to a stunning beerhall and beer garden and is a MUST visit for anyone coming to Glasgow.

beer.beer_description: G40 is a shining example of a Golden Ale. A perfect mix of wheat and aromatic malts give a fuller body and a beautiful backbone of bread like malt sweetness. The fusion of hops (Herkules, Cascade, Chinook and Saaz) balance the beer with bitterness and deliver a big hit of fresh citrus and tropical fruit. Left unfiltered G40 pours hazy to the eye.

items.badge_description: It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 355 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 72. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 23.

beer.beer_description: This hazy golden lager is the unfiltered twin of our ever-popular St. Mungo. Wild West was the child of serendipity but now part of our beer family. Zingy with a bit more bite, it is unconventional and non-conformist just like its drinkers. Wild WEST is a premium lager that finishes with more body and some bitter and yeasty notes.

items.badge_description: Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 20 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 5.
Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 4.

The fusion of hops (Herkules, Cascade, Chinook and Saaz) balance the beer with bitterness and deliver a big hit of fresh citrus and tropical fruit. Left unfiltered G40 pours hazy to the eye.

items.badge_description: Sometimes you need a break from all the hops, fruits, and spices. What better way than with a crisp, smooth Blonde Ale or Golden Ale? Basic but delicious. That's 30 different beers with the style of Blonde Ale or Golden Ale. Try 5 more for Level 7!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 450 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 91.

beer.beer_description: The BEST session lager in Glasgow. An easy drinking lager with a mellow malty finishthat compliments the citrus background.

Brewed with 64% malted wheat, our Bavarian style wheat beer is bursting with flavours of banana and clove. Finished in a traditional unfiltered style, the malty body is complemented by a lightly hopped finish. It is a great accompaniment to sweet and savoury foods, or the perfect fruity refreshment on a sunny afternoon.
West’s signature Munich-style lager beer. Carefully selected imported ingredients create a crisp and clean beer with satisfying malt sweetness, complimented by delicate hop bitterness.

items.badge_description: Hell yea helles! This traditional German pale lager is typically full-bodied, mildly sweet, and light-colored, making it a perfect go to for any occasion. That's 30 different beers with the style of Lager - Helles or Bock - Maibock / Heller (Helles) / Lentebock. Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description: Like IPAs and their American counterparts, our GPA (German Pale Ale) is light with a hoppy finish. It is made with both malted barley and wheat and is strongly hopped with American Chinook and Hallertau Mittelfrueh hops, which perfectly complement its dry, biscuit-y finish.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description: Like IPAs and their American counterparts, our GPA (German Pale Ale) is light with a hoppy finish. It is made with both malted barley and wheat and is strongly hopped with American Chinook and Hallertau Mittelfrueh hops, which perfectly complement its dry, biscuit-y finish.

beer.beer_description: Velo Bloood Orange is a fun and refreshing blend of Heidi Weisse, our unfiltered wheat beer and blood orange soda developed to our own secret recipe. Fresh and fruity, our blood orange Radler is a beautifully balanced, sophisticated yet easy drinking. Free from any nasty ingredients, it's the perfect drink for any occasion.

items.badge_description: Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 120 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 25!

beer.beer_description:
FEIERABEND (pronounced fire – a – bend).

German for ‘finishing time’, ‘down-tools’, clocking off or ‘celebrate the evening and the successful end to the working day.’

The perfect Friday pint of pilsner!

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description: West’s signature Munich-style lager beer. Carefully selected imported ingredients create a crisp and clean beer with satisfying malt sweetness, complimented by delicate hop bitterness.

Like IPAs and their American counterparts, our GPA (German Pale Ale) is light with a hoppy finish. It is made with both malted barley and wheat and is strongly hopped with American Chinook and Hallertau Mittelfrueh hops, which perfectly complement its dry, biscuit-y finish.
The BEST session lager in Glasgow. An easy drinking lager with a mellow malty finishthat compliments the citrus background.
Based on the Vienna Beers of old but with a hefty dose of Munich malt, caramel and biscuit dominate with a very smooth body and slight Perle hop as counter balance.

Brewed with 64% malted wheat, our Bavarian style wheat beer is bursting with flavours of banana and clove. Finished in a traditional unfiltered style, the malty body is complemented by a lightly hopped finish. It is a great accompaniment to sweet and savoury foods, or the perfect fruity refreshment on a sunny afternoon.

G40 is a shining example of a Golden Ale. A perfect mix of wheat and aromatic malts give a fuller body and a beautiful backbone of bread like malt sweetness. The fusion of hops (Herkules, Cascade, Chinook and Saaz) balance the beer with bitterness and deliver a big hit of fresh citrus and tropical fruit. Left unfiltered G40 pours hazy to the eye.

This hazy golden lager is the unfiltered twin of our ever-popular St. Mungo. Wild West was the child of serendipity but now part of our beer family. Zingy with a bit more bite, it is unconventional and non-conformist just like its drinkers. Wild WEST is a premium lager that finishes with more body and some bitter and yeasty notes.

WEST Black is a fabulous 4.6% ABV black and smooth beer which is as smooth as a baby's bottom and has all the hints of chocolate & coffee you'd expect of a stout without any of the bitterness. Plus it's not dispensed with nitrogen so you won't suffer the next day. Come to WEST and enjoy a WEST Black!

A unique recipe to WEST, our Dunkel (meaning dark’ in German) is a special blend of five malts and expertly hopped for added bite, creating a complex beer with an aroma and flavour profile of spice, espresso, dark chocolate, molasses and walnut, yet still highly clean and drinkable.

FEIERABEND (pronounced fire – a – bend).

German for ‘finishing time’, ‘down-tools’, clocking off or ‘celebrate the evening and the successful end to the working day.’

The perfect Friday pint of pilsner!

We have brewed numerous batches of Oktoberfestbier for the annual German festivities we host at our venues each October, and tweak the brewing recipe slightly each time. A rich copper coloured lager, it has hints of biscuit and toast flavours and an initial malty sweetness which are balanced by a moderate hop bitterness.
Only available at King Tut's Wah Wah Hut in Glasgow!

In October 1810, Bavarian Crown Prince Ludwig married Therese of Saxe-Hildburghausen. This is an anniversary that we still celebrate to this day. This one-off brew for our pals at Aldi is a nod to the Marzen lagers that German brewers produce to celebrate Oktoberfest. An amber coloured lager with bold malty flavours.
A dry and crisp pilsner with a hoppy backbone, brewed especially for Aldi stores in Scotland.
A special one-off for our chums at Aldi. Rich and dark lager.

This WEST Coast IPA pays homage to the originators of modern American IPAs.

Malt flavours and a pronounced bitterness support big fruity flavours from modern German hops.

Doppelbock was specifically created by Franconian Monks in the 17th Century for sustenance during fasting periods.  We used both malted barley and malted wheat, some of which have been heavily caramelised and roasted, along with ale yeast fermentation that would be recognisable to the 16h century bock aficionados. This beer took a further twist on modern interpretations by being stored in lowland whisky casks for 168 days.

Wood / Jam / Spice
We have brewed exclusively for Katzenjammers Bierkeller & Restaurant and the result is a delicious Helles beer with lots of citrus flavours!

A fun & refreshing blend of Heidi Weisse, our unfiltered wheat beer and blood orange soda developed our own secret recipe. Fresh and fruity, our blood orange Radler is beautifully balanced, sophisticated yet easy drinking.

BISCUIT. SMOKED. MALTY
Beech wood smoked malt brings a flavour and aroma to this traditional malty lager

Our ethos 'Glaswegian Heart. German Head' always comes together in equal measures to grace most social occasions. However when the head needs to rule this is when the call is NIX! Four different speciality malts were used in the making of this heavily-hopped pale ale. Hop additions of Lemon Drop, Mandarina Bavaria, Chinook and Saphir were used after the boil to create rich citrus notes. Low in alcohol but full in flavour!
